Key Jibe SDK Features and Functionality

RCSe clients vs. Jibe App-to-App enabled applications

The Jibe SDK has been designed to support two fundamentally-different types of applications:

  • RCSe-compliant messaging applications and devices
  • Jibe 'App-to-App'-enabled applications, utilizing the rich communication features within their own experience.

    There can only be one RCSe-compliant application on a device at any one time, which acts as the "default" for all incoming communication. The Jibe Realtime Engine ensures that all communication is as per RCSe standard. These client applications are typically built by handset manufacturers/OEMs or mobile network operators.

    In order to avoid interference with the standard RCSe applications, and to open up the IMS/RCS network securely to the wider developer community, Jibe relies on SIP extensions, and proprietary authentication mechanisms. These mechanisms also enable the correct routing of incoming communication, to the destination application, and facilitate the definition of custom price plans for particular applications by a mobile operator, thus creating a new revenue opportunity for developers.

    Key components of the SDK include:

    Real-time Peer-to-Peer Communications via RCS/IMS

    The Jibe SDK allows applications developers to integrate a complete set of peer-to-peer communication features into their applications:

  • Live video (H.264)
  • Voice over IP (G.711/AMR)
  • One-to-one chat (incl. typing notifications and delivery reports)
  • Group chat
  • File transfer

    Remote wake-up

    The Jibe SDK allows applications to be woken up, when incoming communications are received for that application. In a multiplayer gaming scenario, for example, this eliminates the need to enter a "lobby", prior to challenging somebody to play with. As long as the receiver's handset is turned on, has an active data connection, and has the Jibe Realtime Engine installed, the destination application can be contacted.

    Application Presence/Jibe Friends

    The Jibe SDK allows tracking of which applications are used by a user's contacts, in order to facilitate App-to-App interaction (e.g. launch gaming sessions)

    Multi Application Support

    The Jibe SDK connects to the Jibe Realtime Engine, which runs as a background process on the device. Multiple applications can connect to the Engine, in parallel to each other, and events and intents are routed to the correct destination application, as appropriate.
